text: [Music]
so we're living in a planetary emergency
where biodiversity is declining and a
key step in supporting nature recovery
so it benefits us and the wildlife is
understanding which species we have
where they are and how those populations
are changing one of the ways we do this
is through something called
environmental DNA or read DNA which
relies on the principle that any living
organism in a particular environment
will shed some of its DNA into the
environment itself so the soil or the
water or the air we can collect those
environmental samples extract the DNA
analyze it in the lab to work out which
species were there at that particular
time and we can use this data to really
track the progress we're making with
nature recovery This is complicated it's
a data science and we're working with
Amazon web services to create a data
infrastructure that enables us to do
this at scale across the whole UK
